basic.literature goal: Exploring the relationship between the source of nitrilase and its substrate specificity and stereoselectivity
basic.enzyme criteria: Nine enzymes were selected from 137 nitrilases from three clades distinguished by substrate specificity and stereoselectivity, and two putative enzymes were selected based on sequence similarity, Nit6803 from Synechocystis sp. PCC6803 (PDB entry 3WUY) was chosen as a structural template
basic.chemical criteria: A subset of five aliphatic, nine aromatic, and six arylaliphatic nitriles were chosen from the chemical library of Chem Commun. 2015
basic.activity definition: Ammonium ion concentration after incubation at room temperature for 18 hours
basic.activity condition: in 10uL of potassium phosphate buffer (pH 7.2), the enzyme concentration has two dilutions of 50% and 25%, add 1uL of nitrile substrate, 18 hours, room temperature

experiment.organism: expression in E. coli and were cloned into the pet22(b) vector at the Nde-Sal site
experiment.activity indicator: the chromogenic reaction between o-phthalaldehyde (OPA, 1) and ammonia under acid-catalysed conditions
experiment.activity instrument: Absorbance at 675 nm was measured in a Perkin Elmer 2300 spectrophotometer.

model.description: Test four ML models: Random Forests (RF) and Gradient Boosted Decision Trees (GBDT), as well as kernel-based methods, Support Vector Machines (SVM),  and Logistic Regression (LR). Test some sampling techniques
model.enzyme descriptors: Energy terms evaluated using Rosetta ligand docking; Protein active site descriptors calculated using ProtDcal
model.chemical descriptors: Charge and energy terms calculated using Gaussian; Classical 2D and 3D physicochemical descriptors calculated using MOE
model.activity preprocess: The final amine concentration greater than 2mM is considered active

process.source of enzymes: Table S1 provides the sequence of enzymes
process.source of chemicals: Figure S1 provides the molecular formula of chemicals
